pullRequest.title: Handles creation, change and deletion of BlobSoftRef references
pullRequest.bodyText:
Part 1:
Defining a BlobSoftRef now requires one to define which action should be taken once the Blob is deleted, among the options defined by BaseEntityRef.OnDelete (CASCADE, IGNORE, SET_NULL).
For a BlobSoftRef we mostly use SET_NULL.
REJECT is not accepted and will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
Part 2:
Defines a handler interface and loop to process changed blobs
Part 3:
Revamps the loops (one do all, with common logic around Mongo+SQL in a single abstract class)
Fixes: OX-6076

commit.message: Changes the frequency to 15s for processing blobs to delete

Includes a delete handler when creating a BlobSoftRef

which indicates the action to perform on referenced entities

Fixes: OX-6076

Register and execute delete handlers on referenced entities

Fixes: OX-6076

Changes the frequency to 15s for processing blobs to delete

(JDBC)
Adds a flag indicating that the blob has been changed
Defines an interface responsible to process changed blobs
Adds a loop to process changed blobs using the registered handlers

nodes.bodyText: block delete handler of type Reject?

I would actually throw the exception in the constructor of the ref so it gets thrown right as such a ref is introduced during development and not when a first deletion occurs (which might be during testing or in production)
FIFTHEEN -> FIFTEEN
Maybe include the word Blob in the Class Name and the Loop getName?

commit.message: Corrects typo
Moves place where a valid handler is validated
Renames the blob loops (Entities -> Blobs)

nodes.bodyText: i think the config values for orchestration of the new loops is missing in the component-biz.conf

commit.message: Adjusts the new and renamed loop in the configuration
Annotates the blob parameter as Nonnull

nodes.bodyText: list accepted values
why?
no need to cast on the DB impl here - Blob.getBlobKey() is abstract
make abstract for Blob ? the actual database isn't important here

+
+import sirius.kernel.di.std.Priorized;
+
+import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
+
+/**
+ * Defines handlers to process created or modified {@link MongoBlob blobs}.
+ *
+ * @see ProcessChangedBlobsLoop
+ */
+public interface MongoBlobChangeHandler extends Priorized {

nodes.bodyText: The same changes also have to be applied to the SQL parts
maybe we call it createdOrRenamed instead of changed then?
extract common parts in base class and add JDBC impl
forEachBlobType(entityDescriptor -> entityDescriptor.addCascadeDeleteHandler(this::onDeleteCascade));
s.a.

commit.message:
Renames field: changed -> createdOrRenamed

Also adds an index for faster lookups
Adds list of valid options

Generalizes the usage of MongoBlob and SQLBlob

Renames handler to better represent what it actually does

Unifies the delete and changed loops into one

Also moves common code into an abstract class
Small fixes and JavaDoc corrections

Updates the index to improve loop speeds

The loop uses no space to query deleted or modified items

nodes.bodyText: SQLProcessBlobsLoop?

commit.message: Refactors SQLDeleteBlobsLoop into SQLProcessBlobsLoop

commit.message:
Removes useless method and list

Building up the list each time is not really an overkill and happens only during initialization
Refactors ProcessBlobsLoop -> ProcessBlobChangesLoop
Adds JavaDoc to abstract methods
Moves deletion of the physical file abstract
Removes unnecessary cast

Improves error handling

also moves more common functionality into the abstract class
Improves how counters are used

Update src/main/java/sirius/biz/storage/layer2/BlobSoftRefProperty.java

Co-authored-by: Matthias Keck <60612914+mkeckmkeck@users.noreply.github.com>
